title: How to Convert Pages to PDF on Mac

steps.title: Open the Pages file you want to convert to a PDF.
steps.content: Open the Pages file you want to convert to a PDF. You can do this by double-clicking the Pages file on your Mac. You can also open Pages first and select the document.

steps.title: Click the File menu choose Export To.
steps.content: Click the File menu choose Export To . This expands some file type options.

steps.title: Click PDF… on the menu.
steps.content: Click PDF… on the menu. Now you can select some preferences for your new PDF file.

steps.title: Click the "Image Quality" menu to select the quality of the images in your document.
steps.content: Click the "Image Quality" menu to select the quality of the images in your document. You can choose Good, Better, or Best. The better the quality, the larger the file. If you want to require a password to open the PDF, click the checkbox next to "Require password to open. Then type a password and verify it in the second bar.

steps.title: Click Next to move forward.
steps.content: Click Next to move forward. It's in the lower-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Type a file name into the "Save As" field.
steps.content: Type a file name into the "Save As" field. You can also use the "Where" menu to choose a folder on your Mac to save the file.

steps.title: Click Export to save the new PDF file.
steps.content: Click Export to save the new PDF file. This will export the Pages document as a PDF.
